poem:
"Transparencies of the Affluent"

Grand, glass façades bear no curtains,
Naked to passers-by, no hint of modesty.
A currency of pride, it seems,
Found not in thread and gilt, but absence.
Patagonia garb, Mason-jar delicacies,
Echoed in clear vulnerability.
Yet, believe not this glass charade,
For wealth's true measure is the unseen,
Hidden beneath the spectacle of transparency.
